title: How to Fix a PlayStation 3 Controller That Your PS3 Will Not Detect in Safe Mode

steps.headline: Turn off your console and its controllers.
Locate the reset pin of the defective DualShock®3 controller.
steps.description: It is a hole typically located on the back of the controller near the L2 shoulder button.

steps.headline: Reset the controller.
steps.description: Using a thin object such as a sharpened pencil or an unfolded paperclip, depress the reset pin for at least 20 seconds.

steps.headline: Start your PlayStation®3 console in Safe Mode.
Once you are prompted to, connect your controller to the console and press the PS button.

text: Turn off your console and its controllers.  Locate the reset pin of the defective DualShock®3 controller. It is a hole typically located on the back of the controller near the L2 shoulder button. Reset the controller. Using a thin object such as a sharpened pencil or an unfolded paperclip, depress the reset pin for at least 20 seconds. Start your PlayStation®3 console in Safe Mode.  Once you are prompted to, connect your controller to the console and press the PS button.
